{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33654].
  {panel}

By allowing the Edit action to be visible and editable as a transition in Jira Workflow we will enable

* Post actions on Edit
* Conditions for Edit
* Validations for Edit

I know that people can add an Edit transition that does not change status but this does not replace the default Edit action and also creates confusion -- two Edit buttons with different behavior.

So, Edit action should be editable but not removable from transition list.

By implementing this you will allow people to add important extra functionality to jira without requiring complex third party plugins.
 
Example:  copy one field to another field (before or after this field is updated) - this would allow to save previous value of a field
fields.summary: Edit action should be visible as a transition inside the Workflows

*Problem:* 
* Creating Application Link between Atlassian's Application does not work if the application is running over SSL

*Diagnosis:*
* application link is working correctly if not using HTTPS connection
* certificate has been imported correctly
* StartCom's certificate is used

*Reason:* Lack of StartCom's certificate is causing problems to create Application Links in JIRA/Ondemand. 
https://www.startssl.com/?app=25#31

*Workaround:* Refer to the steps in http://docs.codehaus.org/display/HAUSMATES/Installing+a+new+CA+into+the+JDK
fields.summary: Import StartCom root certificates to Java's certificates store

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33642].
  {panel}

Hi,

Due to some unexplained cause, we have found that our JIRA Charting plugin was not recording average time in status (ATIS) data and date of first response (DOFR) because the necessary custom fields were never active on the system.  Others have mentioned this issue in answers.atlassian; I don't think that it's been officially addressed; however, we've made the necessary additions for these charts to _start_ generating data.

The problem, then, is that our existing projects have no historical data to work with in order to populate these charts.

The formats of these custom fields are simple maps of durations or transition times between states.  As such, it would _seem_ as if it should be simple to make a utility that would do the following:

* Expose a function that allows an administrator to re-generate the custom field data for a project:
** Based on the recorded activity of the issue, which exists in the database
** The admin can by default choose not to include issues where that data exists
* Ideally, it would be nice for this not to cause X notifications of changes.
fields.summary: [JIRA Charting] Add mechanism to re-generate ATIS and/or DOFR field data

One customer noticed Plugin License Storage plugin was also disabled and after uninstalling Tempo completely he is still unable to enable the Plugin License Storage plugin.

These customers seem to have latest version of UPM plugin.

See details from one customer in https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/JTMPO-862

This is high priority issue.  Can you advice us on what is happening and a solution. 

h3. Workaround

This can be worked around by rolling back to the bundled version of the HipChat plugin with the following:

# Stop JIRA.
# Remove all new versions of the HipChat plugin from {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}}, for example {{hipchat-core-plugin-0.6.jar}} & {{hipchat-for-jira-plugin-1.2.1.jar}}.
# Start JIRA.
# Avoid updating the HipChat plugin until this issue is resolved.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33628].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a JIRA filter with some sample issues in it (Example of JQL filter: status = open)
# Access the filter then close one of the issue
# Click on *Return to Search* in the issue viewing page
# Then the filter result will still remain the same showing the closed issue (no refresh occur)
# You will need to manually click on the small refresh icon in issue navigator or refresh the whole page to get the updated filter result in the issue navigator

h3. Comparision in JIRA Server 5.2.11
However, it won't happen in this way when in *JIRA 5.2.11*
When you select *Return to Search*, it will *automatically refresh* and show the updated filter result (with no manual refresh required) in the issue navigator
fields.summary: Filter page not refresh after modification on issues

We need to export one or more projects regularily but currently the only possible way seems to be to do a full export, then export only the wanted projects into a clean instance and then to do a full export of the new instance.

This is too cumbersome to be feasible since it requires manual creation of workflows & custom fields which we use quite heavily.

Also there are already quite a few requests which are marked as duplicates of JRA-1604 which is marked as 'Resolved' which is wrong since it is not resolved (as in that functionality is not available up to 6.0.2).

Please either reopen the linked issue or track that functionality here.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33605].
  {panel}

At the moment, custom field option has a limitation of 255 characters. And due to this, this actually opens the possibility for customer to configure a long String as an option for a custom field.

However when configuring a long String as an option for a custom field (eg: Select List custom field), the custom field value is truncated in the Issue Navigator (Basic Search). Please see the following sample screenshot for more details of this behavior:
!scshot.png!

This behavior basically affects the usability of the Issue Navigator Basic Search, especially if we have more than one long options for a custom field.

It will be great if we can format the custom field option 'popup' so that a long custom field option is displayed properly in the Issue Navigator Basic Search.

This behavior is tested in JIRA 5.2.6 and JIRA 6.0.1.
fields.summary: Long custom field options are truncated in the Issue Navigator

  {panel}

h5. Summary
As of now, JIRA's Bulk Change for edit issues show all fields, whether or not the fields are related to the selected issues. That way, users might accidentally/mistakenly make changes to the fields that are not intended to be changed.

h5. Suggestion
To be able to have a Bulk Change in Project Level, such as in Project Administration page. With this, the Bulk Change will show only fields from the project, and disregard any unrelated fields.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit shows only related fields

Security Vulnerabilities Information:
* http://tomcat.apache.org/security-6.html#Fixed_in_Apache_Tomcat_6.0.36

So customer considering to upgrade to latest JIRA version (6.0.2). However the tomcat version that come bundled with it (7.0.29) is still exposed to security vulnerabilities as stated on the follow documentation from tomcat:

* http://tomcat.apache.org/security-7.html#Fixed_in_Apache_Tomcat_7.0.30

{quote}
*Important: Denial of service* CVE-2012-3544
When processing a request submitted using the chunked transfer encoding, Tomcat ignored but did not limit any extensions that were included. This allows a client to perform a limited DOS by streaming an unlimited amount of data to the server.

This was fixed in revisions 1378702 and 1378921.

This issue was reported to the Tomcat security team on 10 November 2011 and made public on 10 May 2013.

Affects: 7.0.0-7.0.29

*Moderate: DIGEST authentication weakness* CVE-2012-3439
Three weaknesses in Tomcat's implementation of DIGEST authentication were identified and resolved:

# Tomcat tracked client rather than server nonces and nonce count.
# When a session ID was present, authentication was bypassed.
# The user name and password were not checked before when indicating that a nonce was stale.

These issues reduced the security of DIGEST authentication making replay attacks possible in some circumstances.

This was fixed in revision 1377807.

The first issue was reported by Tilmann Kuhn to the Tomcat security team on 19 July 2012. The second and third issues were discovered by the Tomcat security team during the resulting code review. All three issues were made public on 5 November 2012.

Affects: 7.0.0-7.0.29

*Important: Bypass of security constraints* CVE-2012-3546

When using FORM authentication it was possible to bypass the security constraint checks in the FORM authenticator by appending /j_security_check to the end of the URL if some other component (such as the Single-Sign-On valve) had called request.setUserPrincipal() before the call to FormAuthenticator#authenticate().

This was fixed in revision 1377892.

This issue was identified by the Tomcat security team on 13 July 2012 and made public on 4 December 2012.

Affects: 7.0.0-7.0.29
{quote}

Customer requested this information to be conveyed here and to change the future bundled version to a later version to avoid on the security vulnerabilities stated.

Currently the only way to bypass this security threat is by deploying WAR installation with later version of tomcat.
fields.summary: Upgrade bundled Tomcat to the latest minor release

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33562].
  {panel}

There are two things that are frustrating with the new search issue status code selection interface.    The example is selecting all status codes except for closed and on hold status codes.

1)  It is very frustrating trying to select multiple when the number of items is larger than the dropdown list since the list keeps reorganizing and you lose your position where you left when trying to select multiple items..

2) You need to keep scrolling back to select your next status value.

I attached a mp4 video showing the issue.

My personal suggestions are
1) Do not move the selection to the top of the list until the next time the dropdown list is opened.    The user continues selecting until either the user moves the user outside the dropdown area (for a long enough period of time or clicks outside the dropdown window.

2) or open the selection area showing all the status codes so no scrolling will be necessary

1) Provide an reverse selection similar to the clear selection to minimize the number of items that needs to be selected.
This is not an advanced item when you want to see all issues not closed.
fields.summary: using the status selection dropdown on the issue search screen is very frustrating

The projects for which a user has no role membership should be shown under the blue message info box so that they can be clicked and then appear in the table underneath.

*if* they have no category they are "Uncategorised", and are currently shown as:

However, the projects for which the user has no role membership *and* have been assigned a project category are not shown:

See a 5.2.X Screenshot below for the expected behaviour:
!categorised_projects_no_role_memberships_5_2_11.png!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33534].
  {panel}

From JIRA 4.4.5 (if I'm not wrong -- JIRA 5.0.x already has this feature) it is possible enabling the mail logs without adding _-Dmail.debug=true_ to the JIRA Startup Options. It can be done on _Administration -> Troubleshooting and Support -> Logging & Profiling -> Enable Debug Logs_ (for both Incoming and Outgoing mail servers).

The following page only apply to JIRA 4.4.4 and earlier versions:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+email+protocol+details

Please update it. 

Best regards,
Lucas Timm
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Update documentation about enabling the JIRA Mail Logs

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33531].
  {panel}

Hi Team,

When a user create a issue on JIRA using Crucible, this issue is liked to the user.
But if the user change this issue, like moving it to another project on JIRA, the link will not be changed on Crucible side.
It was going to be great if Jira could check if the issue on JIRA has reviews and ask to update it's links when moving between projects for example.

Thanks
fields.summary: Change links on JIRA and Crucible when moving a project.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33530].
  {panel}

Current:

UI in work log does not indicate that it has it's own comment stream. This results in users having to use the ALL tab in order to see work log comments inline with their normal comments. This shows significantly more information than the user is looking for.

Expected:

All comments and work log comments should be visible at once in the comment tab.

Requested improvement:

Add an option to show all comments inline. Not sure if this should be on a per user, per project, or per system level.
fields.summary: Add option to show work log comments inline with normal comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33522].
  {panel}

Sometimes a issue changes more than once per minute, e.q. in a meeting to get the issue 'ready'. If this is case, the reporter and watcher receives a email every time a change is entered in the issue. This is generating a lot of email.
(In our case the reporter is the customer and we don't want to get annoyed by the huge load of emails).

I would like to have the possibility (in a notification scheme) to delay the emails, so that multiple changes are combined in one email, rather than several smaller emails every change. Or the possibility to select to get only one email a day.

This improvement I would very much like to see in the next version.
fields.summary: Delayed sending of notifications emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33521].
  {panel}

When JIRA is connected with Crowd and Crowd fails during the time that a user is using Confluence, the following stacktrace is displayed : 
{noformat}
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.CommunicationException
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.convertOperationFailedException(CrowdServiceImpl.java:866)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.authenticate(CrowdServiceImpl.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.DelegatingCrowdService.authenticate(DelegatingCrowdService.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.authenticate(FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.login.LoginManagerImpl$InternalStaticDependencies.authenticate(LoginManagerImpl.java:415)
{noformat} 

Steps to reproduce :
* Integrate JIRA with Crowd
* Login to JIRA with a user from Crowd
* Shutdown Crowd 
* Try to perform some action on JIRA.

JIRA should catch the Crowd exception in a better way and communicate to the user that the Crowd server is no longer accessible.

h4.Diagnosis and Resolution
Please follow the diagnosis and resolution steps from the knowledge base article [JIRA drops LDAP configuration - java.naming.provider.url property does not contain a URL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+drops+LDAP+configuration+-+java.naming.provider.url+property+does+not+contain+a+URL].
fields.summary: JIRA should catch Crowd failures gracefully

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33477].
  {panel}

Using OnDemand JIRA 6.0.x (whatever the latest on-demand is)

If I go to:

Tools -> User Management
Then I find a user and click: Edit

I cannot add multiple email addresses. This edit profile dialog should allow administrators to associate multiple email addresses with a JIRA account.

Reasoning:
What would be the purpose of this?

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email

I have developers that have multiple email addresses for support reasons. If they try to raise an issue via email or add a comment to an issue via email and are signed into an email account not registered with JIRA - then JIRA doesn't know what to do with the email that it received (if you have create new users via email disabled - which we do). JIRA not knowing what to do with the unrecognizable email address is understandable. 

However we should be able to associate multiple email addresses with one JIRA user, so then JIRA will correctly be able to raise Issues or add comments to existing issues.

It is really irritating that JIRA does not support this. This means all developers need to inconveniently log out of their email and log into another email account OR mess with their email account settings and temporarily change their "sent from" setting to show the email address registered with JIRA. Sometimes switching "sent from" or email accounts means we can't do a simple cc / bcc: to our JIRA system as the email we need to send for support reasons needs to show up as sent from an email that is not registered with the JIRA user. So then it is a bunch more work to copy / paste stuff around and switch out the accounts to the correct email account registered with JIRA.

This is incredibly inconvenient and wastes a lot of time. Developers find this really annoying and say not so nice things. :-D
fields.summary: Allow multiple email addresses to be associated with one user

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33461].
  {panel}

If you click on any filter right now, the URL will include the first issue from the result set in it. If you send this to another user, since the first issue is in the URL it will be included. Even if the issue no longer falls within the filter, it will perpetually show the "extra" issue in the detail pane. See screenshot for details.

Workaround:

1. Switch to list view. Resulting link will be like: https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?filter=12345
2. Right click on the filter link and use that. The format will be something like: https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=12345
fields.summary: Improve ability to link to filter results in detail view in issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33458].
  {panel}

We have dozens of projects in Jira and are creating more over time.  We would prefer a project key length greater than 10 characters because we will shortly run into uniqueness problems with how we like to name and key our projects. 

A length of 16 would serve us much better - 10 is too restrictive in our view.

The convention we use for project keys is:
[product abbreviation]_[release]

Examples:
PROD1_1311
PROD1_1312
PROD2_1401
PROD2_1405

Concerns we have are the following:
a) we have many product lines and we prefer the Jira project key be descriptive and recognizable 
b) we sometimes have long release labels
c) we would prefer that dots(.) be allowed to better match our releases
d) we currently use [A-Za-z0-9_\.]+ for our custom project key pattern (regex)
e) we like to keep current with Jira, but moving from 5.x to 6.x is currently a concern because of Project Keys.
fields.summary: Jira Project Key length and values

Most of the sample tutorials for plugin are based on older versions of JIRA which are compatible with JDK 1.6. Trying to build the plugin on a platform with JDK 1.7 will fail due to compatibility issues. It will be nice to do the following:

# Provide a hint on this link https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+Developer+Documentation to let users know about the compatibility
# Hint users that they can try to build this on a later version of JIRA with JDK 1.7 by changing the JIRA version from the pom.xml

This is reported from https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/178835/atlas-run-in-tutorial-jira-simple-csv-importer-does-not-work
fields.summary: Provide a hint on the plugin development page about the JDK version

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
We’ve now addressed this in the [new issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORECLOUD/The+new+Jira+issue+view]!
- When the date of the action is <= 7 days ago, you’ll be able to switch between relative and absolute formats by clicking on the timestamp.
- When the date of the action is > 7 days ago, it will always show the timestamp in absolute format, as per our design guidelines.

If you don’t have the new issue view yet, you can try it out by clicking on your avatar > Personal settings then turning on New Jira issue view under Labs. For more info, check out [The new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORECLOUD/The+new+Jira+issue+view].
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33449].
{panel}
Activities on issues display "Updated 1 hour ago" instead of the actual time stamp. I've searched through the support documentation for 6.0.1 and earlier versions, and have been unable to find instructions for Administrators to change the configuration to always display the actual time/date of activity.

Please advise.
h5. Workaround:
 * There was a workaround by modifying the jira-config.properties file that is no more applicable. 

h5. Expected behaviour: 
* Display actual dates/timestamps rather than relative
* Or makig this configurable. 

h5. Note: 
For now hover over the displayed date is the temporary solution for this behaviour
fields.summary: Make View change timestamp configurable (use time instead of "1 hour ago")
